item.title: 股市涨势建立在充满风险的叙述之上

item.title: 塞恩斯伯里正在商谈将 Argos 部门出售给中国的 JD.com

item.title: 关税面临法律威胁，特朗普的赤字计划岌岌可危
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统为控制美国前所未有的预算赤字而采取的最具体措施--全面提高关税--面临着被法律推翻的危险，这将使美国的财政状况更加摇摇欲坠。【原文：President Donald Trump’s most concrete step to rein in unprecedented US budget deficits — sweeping tariff hikes — faces the danger of a legal reversal that would put the nation’s finances on an even shakier footing.】

item.title: 博茨瓦纳因钻石价格下滑被 S&P 下调信用评级
item.description: 博茨瓦纳的信用评级被 S&P 全球评级公司下调，这是对其依赖钻石的经济的又一次打击。【原文：Botswana’s credit rating was cut by S&P Global Ratings, another blow to its diamond-dependent economy that’s struggling with a slump in demand for its gems.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：就业疲软、通胀稳定是美联储降息的标志
item.description: 美国就业年增长率创纪录地向下修正，再加上最新的通胀数据没有出现意外，这为美联储下周降息埋下了伏笔。【原文：A record downward revision to annual US job growth, paired with no surprises in the latest inflation data, sealed the deal for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates next week.】

item.title: 贝莱德斥资 5 亿英镑押注被忽视的英国数据中心
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. ）计划向英国数据中心市场的一个被忽视的角落投入高达 5 亿英镑（6.78 亿美元）的资金，该公司在首席执行官拉里-芬克（Larry Fink）准备与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）一起对英国进行国事访问之际公布了这一承诺。【原文：BlackRock Inc. plans to pour as much as £500 million ($678 million) into an overlooked corner of Britain’s data center market, a commitment it unveiled as Chief Executive Officer Larry Fink prepares to join US President Donald Trump on his state visit to the UK.】

item.title: Sole 称意大利 Snam 公司计划推迟欧洲开放电网交易

item.title: 抛开野蛮的悲观情绪，英国市场有理由充满希望
item.description: 对我来说，这一周都在谈论英国股票的悲惨遭遇。首先，我就崩盘的首次公开募股市场拍摄了一些视频。市场崩溃的程度可想而知：皮尔-亨特（Peel Hunt）表示，2004 年至 2012 年间，英国上市公司数量减少了约 40%。【原文：For me, it’s been a week of chatting about the miseries of UK equities. First, I filmed a bit on the subject of the collapsing initial public offerings market. And it’s been quite some collapse: Between 2004 and 2012, saysPeel Hunt, the number of listed companies in the UK fell by around 40%.】

item.title: 特朗普对英国的重要访问正值斯塔默最糟糕的时刻
item.description: 基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）首相在去年 7 月当选时承诺，在保守党多年的混乱和丑闻之后，要建立一个 "更安静 "的政治。在不到一周的时间里，英国政府就有两名高级官员因丑闻丧生，这让首相面临着一项他从未想象过的指控：他的工党政府并不比保守党逊色。【原文：Prime Minister Keir Starmer was elected last July promising a “quieter” politics after years of chaos and scandal under the Conservatives. Losing two senior members of the UK government to scandal in less than a week sees the premier facing a charge he could never have imagined: that his Labour administration is no less noisy than the Tories.】

item.title: 特朗普申请取消对马里兰州海上风电场的批准
item.description: 特朗普政府要求联邦法院取消对马里兰州沿海一个计划投资 60 亿美元的风电项目的批准，以此作为阻止开发近海清洁能源的更广泛努力的一部分。【原文：The Trump administration asked a federal court to cancel the approval of a $6 billion wind project planned off the coast of Maryland as part of a wider effort to halt the development of the offshore clean- energy resource.】

item.title: 美国银行称新兴市场投资者流入是 2026 年的事

item.title: 路透社称美联储主席库克宣布第二套住房为度假屋

item.title: 荷兰银行将重组风险角色，称可能裁员
item.description: 荷兰银行（ABN Amro Bank NV）首席执行官玛格丽特-贝拉尔德（Marguerite Berard）在向投资者介绍该行新战略的两个月前，正在重组全行与风险相关的职位。【原文：ABN Amro Bank NV is reorganizing risk-related roles across the bank, two months before Chief Executive Officer Marguerite Berard is slated to brief investors on the bank’s new strategy.】
